title: Researching Arts, Health and Wellbeing
abstractText:
The proposed Seminar Programme will bring into dialogue different academic and practitioner perspectives, involving established researchers and major organisations in the field of Arts, Health and Wellbeing. Through this dialogue, the aim of the Seminar Programme is fourfold:

  • to generate consensus on the 'big questions' for Arts, Health and Wellbeing research
  • to advance and deepen theoretical, conceptual and methodological research on the processes and practices in Arts, Health and Wellbeing
  • to develop strategies for advocacy and knowledge exchange with policy-makers, funders and arts agencies and practitioners
  • to establish the foundations for a national network in Arts, Health and Wellbeing research and practice.

The aims will be addressed through a series of four one-day interdisciplinary seminars, each of which will comprise formal paper presentations in two sessions and a round-table discussion. Seminars will be held in Nottingham, Glasgow, Bristol and London, March 2013-September 2014. Opportunities for the art of performance-based practitioner interventions will be provided where appropriate. Contributors will be either academics, practitioners, postgraduates students, or drawn from our list of “users”. A Steering group will oversee the programme.
